title: Mathematics Learning Design for Cross-Cultural Design Collaboration

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience in using online learning tools
context.additional_context: A mathematics-integrated module within a teacher training program, analyzing and applying collaborative design cases that reflect diverse cultural backgrounds.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three patterns of mathematical problem-solving that arise during cross-cultural remote collaboration.
Learners can inductively and deductively analyze math collaboration scenarios by applying a mixed-methods research design.
Learners can apply at least five core principles when designing math learning activities that consider cultural differences in an LMS environment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
